mx:datafield.mx:subfield: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Cn. Marcius vates)

28. Halbbd., col. 1538, 1541-1542; "Marcius", #2 (Marcius; Marcius vates; under the name Marcius a collection of praecepta from 2 cent. B.C., but it is difficult to decide whether there is any connection with vates Marcius)

p. 537 (Marcius; eponymous author of a number of miscellaneous oracular sayings current in Rome in early days. According to Cicero, there were Marcii frates, men of noble birth who wrote prophecies; according to Livy, there was only one, vates Marcius. Of an ancient collection of praecepta under the name Marcius three Saturnian quotations survive; connection with Marcius vates uncertain).
